Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the capability.

Status.description:
The current status of the capability. Valid values include:

- `CREATING` – The capability is being created.
- `ACTIVE` – The capability is running and available.
- `UPDATING` – The capability is being updated.
- `DELETING` – The capability is being deleted.
- `CREATE_FAILED` – The capability creation failed.
- `UPDATE_FAILED` – The capability update failed.
- `DELETE_FAILED` – The capability deletion failed.

CreatedAt.description: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the capability was created.

ModifiedAt.description: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds for when the capability was last modified.

Version.description: The version of the capability software that is currently running.

Configuration.ArgoCd.ServerUrl.description: The URL of the Argo CD server. Use this URL to access the Argo CD web interface and API.

Configuration.ArgoCd.AwsIdc.IdcManagedAp.description: The ARN of the managed application created in IAM Identity Center for this Argo CD capability. This application is automatically created and managed by EKS.

AwsIdc.description: Configuration for integrating Argo CD with IAM Identity Center. This allows you to use your organization's identity provider for authentication to Argo CD.

Namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace where Argo CD resources will be created. If not specified, the default namespace is used.

NetworkAccess.description: Configuration for network access to the Argo CD capability's managed API server endpoint. By default, the Argo CD server is accessible via a public endpoint. You can optionally specify one or more VPC endpoint IDs to enable private connectivity from your VPCs.

RbacRoleMappings.description: A list of role mappings that define which IAM Identity Center users or groups have which Argo CD roles. Each mapping associates an Argo CD role (ADMIN, EDITOR, or VIEWER) with one or more IAM Identity Center identities.

ServerUrl.description: The URL of the Argo CD server. Use this URL to access the Argo CD web interface and API.

ArgoCd.description: Configuration settings for an Argo CD capability. This includes the Kubernetes namespace, IAM Identity Center integration, RBAC role mappings, and network access configuration.

Identities.description: A list of IAM Identity CenterIAM; Identity Center identities (users or groups) that should be assigned this Argo CD role.

Role.description:
The Argo CD role to assign. Valid values are:

- `ADMIN` – Full administrative access to Argo CD.
- `EDITOR` – Edit access to Argo CD resources.
- `VIEWER` – Read-only access to Argo CD resources.

ArgoCdRoleMapping.description: A mapping between an Argo CD role and IAM Identity CenterIAM; Identity Center identities. This defines which users or groups have specific permissions in Argo CD.

IdcInstanceArn.description: The ARN of the IAM Identity Center instance to use for authentication.

IdcManagedApplicationArn.description: The ARN of the managed application created in IAM Identity Center for this Argo CD capability. This application is automatically created and managed by EKS.

IdcRegion.description: The Region where your IAM Identity Center instance is located.

AwsIdc.description: Configuration for integrating Argo CD with IAM Identity Center. This allows you to use your organization's identity provider for authentication to Argo CD.

ArgoCd.description: Configuration settings for an Argo CD capability. This includes the Kubernetes namespace, IAM Identity Center integration, RBAC role mappings, and network access configuration.

CapabilityConfiguration.description: Configuration settings for a capability. The structure of this object varies depending on the capability type.

VpceIds.description: A list of VPC endpoint IDs to associate with the managed Argo CD API server endpoint. Each VPC endpoint provides private connectivity from a specific VPC to the Argo CD server. You can specify multiple VPC endpoint IDs to enable access from multiple VPCs.

NetworkAccess.description: Configuration for network access to the Argo CD capability's managed API server endpoint. By default, the Argo CD server is accessible via a public endpoint. You can optionally specify one or more VPC endpoint IDs to enable private connectivity from your VPCs.

Id.description: The unique identifier of the IAM Identity CenterIAM; Identity Center user or group.

Type.description: The type of identity. Valid values are `SSO_USER` or `SSO_GROUP` .

SsoIdentity.description: An IAM Identity CenterIAM; Identity Center identity (user or group) that can be assigned permissions in a capability.

description: An object representing a managed capability in an Amazon EKS cluster. This includes all configuration, status, and health information for the capability.

CapabilityName.description: The unique name of the capability within the cluster.

ClusterName.description: The name of the Amazon EKS cluster that contains this capability.

Configuration.description: The configuration settings for the capability. The structure varies depending on the capability type.

DeletePropagationPolicy.description: The delete propagation policy for the capability. Currently, the only supported value is `RETAIN` , which keeps all resources managed by the capability when the capability is deleted.

RoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that the capability uses to interact with AWS services.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

Type.description: The type of capability. Valid values are `ACK` , `ARGOCD` , or `KRO` .
